18th July 1919.
THE PRACTICE OF MEDICINE IN THE TROPICS.
Dear General Carter,
div1.p:
I am much obliged for your recent
letter and its enclosures. When the map has
been reproduced it will be sent for your appro-
val, but it is not easy to decide how to indicate
the areas in West Africa, and I only hope that
you will be pleased with the result.

As to the “quarantine regulations”, I
quite understand your inability to deal with these
at present and, as a consequence, we have attempted
to summarize them, and any corrections you may wish
can be made in the usual way in the proofs.

As to the bibliography, the same remark
applies. Our idea was to give references, not in
support of the information contained in the body of
the article, but to enable the reader to pursue his
study beyond the scope of our book.
